title: Moving charges - changing speed in magnetic field

content.question: A charged particle entering a magnetic field follows a circular path of radius <math alttext="r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> within that field, as shown in the figure. A second charged particle, identical to the first, enters the same magnetic field traveling at a velocity twice that of the first and follows a circular path of radius <math alttext="r sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the ratio of the second radius <math alttext="r sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to the first radius, <math alttext="r sub 2, to, r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
